title.narrative: Support to institutional strengthening of the National Regulatory Authority (NRA)

description.narrative: Support to institutional strengthening of the National Regulatory Authority (NRA) for the Unexploded Ordnance (UXO)/Mine Action Sector in Lao PDR for 2017-2021, for better coordination and regulation of the UXO sector

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS AND INTERNATIONAL TRADE (DFAIT) GOVERMENT OF CANADA
GOVERNMENT OF LAO PEOPLES DEMOCRATIC RE

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1.1 Percentage of population in UXO-contaminated communities who perceive that UXO interventions have supported improvements in safety and better lives. (CPD Indicator 1.3.1) 1.2 Timely annual submission of Article 7 Report under CCM. 1.3 Legislation drafted in line with Article 9 of the CCM and presented to NRA Board. 1.4 Task prioritisation criteria approved by NRA Board. 1.5 Annual Sector Reports produced with IMSMA used as sole source of quantitative data for clearance and survey progress by NRA, and including gender- and age-disaggregated data on victim assistance and mine risk education beneficiaries. 1.6 Quarterly sector-level progress data made available in open format by NRA. 1.7 Sector M&E Plan adopted by NRA including monitoring of community participation, evaluation of survey effectiveness, gender indicators and pro-poor prioritisation. 1.8 Disability policy discussed at UXO Sector Working Group. 1.9 Victim Assistance Action Plan developed by NRA in line with UNMAS Gender Guidelines. 1.10 Sustainability Strategy for UXO Sector drafted and raised at UXO Sector Working Group. 1.11 Cash contribution to UXO sector by Government of Lao PDR reported annually by NRA in Sector Report. 1.12 Availability of monthly Financial Management Reports by both NRA and UXO Lao. 1.13 Number of reported UXO casualties per year. 1.14 Number of Humanitarian Clearance Teams of the Lao People’s Army trained and equipped by UNDP. 1.15 Number of annual QM assessments of nationally-owned training facilities. 1.16 Progress towards SDG18 on UXO 2.1 % of UXO Lao clearance within “High Priority” areas according to NRA Sector Work Plan. 2.2. Sector Annual Work Plan produced by NRA including prioritisation of all tasks. 2.3 % of UXO Lao clearance within CHAs. 2.4 % of survey and clearance tasks subject to NRA Quality Management. 2.5 % of Post Clearance Assessments (PCA) which indicate compliance with pre-clearance plans. 2.6 % of risk education activities in UXO Lao Annual Wo

comment.narrative: 1.1. NA- impact survey has not yet been undertaken. 1.2. Yes- the Article 7 report was submitted before the given deadline. Additionally, NRA representatives attended the 9th Meeting of State Parties in Geneva in September 2019, where the Article 4 extension request was approved. 1.3 No- the drafting process has not yet begun but consultations have been held in September and December 2019 in order to establish the drafting committee. 1.4. NA- discussions around task prioritisation has taken place but the criteria have not yet been approved on a national level by NRA Board. 1.5. Yes- the 2018 Annual Sector Report was published this year with results based solely on IMSMA figures, which were disaggregated by age and sex. 1.6. Yes- such information is published and updated monthly by the NRA Information Management team on the NRA website. 1.7. NA. 1.8. Yes- the NRA Director General referred to the new disability policy being drafted to implement the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities and highlighted it as a great opportunity for the sector. 1.9. NA- an initial workshop to draft the next 5-Year Victim Assistance Action Plan was held but will not be developed until 2021, when the current Plan will end. 1.10 No - the issue was raised by UNDP at the Sector Working Group, highlighting that a sustainable plan is needed for 2020 to address funding gaps, but a strategy was not presented at the meeting. 1.11 Yes- the Annual Sector Report 2018 referred to the in-kind contribution received from the government of Lao PDR in the form of office space. 1.12 Yes- such reports can be made readily available. 1.13 Yes – there have been 8 casualties nationwide as of the 4th December 2019. 1.14 Yes. Two additional humanitarian clearance teams of the Lao People’s Army have been trained this year. Equipment is currently being procured for these teams. 1.15 NA- the NRA does not conduct QM of the UXO Lao training centre, but rather UXO Lao conducts this process internally. 1.16 Yes- the target set is 2030, but progress is being made towards achieving these results (such as the large reduction in UXO casualty rates) 2.1. Yes- All activities conducted by UXO Lao in 2019 considered to be high priority. 2.2. NA- no Sector Annual Work Plan is prepared by the NRA, but rather an internal NRA Annual Work Plan. 2.3. 77% (as of November 2019) 2.4. NA-NRA Quality Management is done by area size and targets vary by donor. 2.5. NA- PCA forms not referred to in the annual reports of operators. The QM team, however, monitors compliance during inspection. 2.6. 80% (as of November 2019) 2.7. This percentage support was not listed as an activity in the Annual Work Plan for the VA unit for 2019 and not available either on the Dashboard/IMSMA/Annual Review Report. Therefore, the information was not recorded but the VA unit regularly follow-up with victims and their families.

1.1. NA- impact survey has not yet been undertaken. 1.2. Yes- Article 7 of the CCM transparency report was submitted. Additionally, 10th Meeting of State Parties to the CCM or Second Review Conference of the CCM (2RC) attended by the Embassy of the Lao PDR to the Swiss Confederation/Permanent Mission of the Lao PDR to the UN Office in Geneva. 1.3 No - the drafting process has begun but consultations have been held in 2020 in order to establish the drafting committee. 1.4. NA - discussions around task prioritization has taken place but the criteria have not yet been approved by NRA Board. 1.5. Yes - the 2019 Annual Sector Report was published this year with results based solely on IMSMA figures, which were disaggregated by age and sex. 1.6. Yes- such information is published and updated monthly by the NRA Information Management team on the NRA website. 1.7. NA. 1.8. Yes-new disability policy being drafted to implement the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities and highlighted it as a great opportunity for the sector. 1.9. NA- Workshops to draft the next 5-Year Victim Assistance Strategy were held but Victim Assistance Action Plan will not be developed until 2021, when the current Plan will end. 1.10 No - the issue was raised by UNDP at the Sector Working Group, highlighting that a sustainable plan is needed from 2021 to address funding gaps, but a strategy was not drafted so far. 1.11 Yes - the Annual Sector Report 2019 referred to the contribution received from the government of Lao PDR 1.12 Yes - such reports can be made readily available. 1.13 Yes– there have been 27 casualties nationwide as of the 29 December 2020. 1.14 Yes- 21 members (3 females) of humanitarian clearance teams of the Lao People’s Army were trained in 2020. Equipment is also provided for these teams. 1.15 NA- the NRA does not conduct QM of the UXO Lao training centre, but rather UXO Lao conducts this process internally. 1.16 Yes- the target set is 2030, but progress is being made towards achieving these results (such as the large reduction in UXO casualty rates) 2.1. Yes- All activities conducted by UXO Lao in 2019 considered to be high priority. 2.2. Yes- UXO Sector Annual Work Plan 2021-2025 has been prepared by the NRA. 2.3. 80% (TBC) 2.4. NA- NRA Quality Management is done by area size and targets vary by donor. 2.5. NA- PCA forms not referred to in the annual reports of operators. The QM team, however, monitors compliance during inspection. 2.6. 100% of Annual Work Plan achieved up to the end of December 2020. 2.7. NA.

1.1. NA- impact survey has not yet been undertaken. 1.2. Yes- Article 7 of the CCM transparency report was submitted. 1.3 No - the drafting process has begun in 2020 by drafting committee and consultations have been held in 2021. Draft PM decree will be finalized in 2022. 1.4. NA - discussions around task prioritization has taken place but the criteria have not yet been approved by NRA Board. 1.5. Yes - the 2020 Annual Sector Report was published 2021 with results based solely on IMSMA figures, which were disaggregated by age and sex. 1.6. NA 1.10 Yes - the issue was raised by UNDP and other DPs at the Sector Working Group, highlighting that a sustainable plan is needed as part of next 10 year strategy. 1.11 Yes - the Annual Sector Report 2020 referred to the contribution received from the government of Lao PDR 1.12 Yes - such reports can be made readily available. 1.13 Yes– there have been 45 casualties nationwide as of the 22 November 2021. 1.14 Yes- 7 humanitarian clearance teams of the Lao People’s Army were trained in 2021. Equipment is also provided for these teams. 1.15 1- the NRA conducted QM of the UXO Lao training centre (NTC) as NTC was transferred to NRA from UXO Lao 1.16 Yes- the target set is 2030, but progress was shared through VNR 2021. 2.1.
